Sentencas: This article aims to develop an entropy based method of systematically improving efficiency of fuel cells.
Titulo: Entropy based design of fuel cells

Sentencas: Entropy production of both electrochemical and thermofiuid irreversibilities is formulated based on the Second Law.
Titulo: Entropy based design of fuel cells

Sentencas: Ohmic, concentration, and activation irreversibilities occur within the electrodes, while thermal and friction irreversibilities occur within the fuel channel.
Titulo: Entropy based design of fuel cells

Sentencas: These irreversibilities reduce the overall cell efficiency by generating voltage losses.
Titulo: Entropy based design of fuel cells

Sentencas: Unlike past studies, this article considers fuel channel irreversibilities within the total entropy production, for both solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) and proton exchange membrane fuel cells (PEMFCs).
Titulo: Entropy based design of fuel cells

Sentencas: Predicted results of entropy production are shown at varying operating temperatures, surface resistances, and channel configurations.
Titulo: Entropy based design of fuel cells

Sentencas: Numerical predictions are compared successfully against past measured data of voltage profiles, thereby providing useful validation of the entropy based formulation.
Titulo: Entropy based design of fuel cells

Sentencas: The Second Law stipulates the maximum theoretical capability of energy conversion within the fuel cell.
Titulo: Entropy based design of fuel cells

Sentencas: Unlike past methods characterizing voltage losses through overpotential or polarization curves, the entropy based method provides a useful alternative and systematic procedure for reducing voltage losses.
Titulo: Entropy based design of fuel cells
